synopsis.text:
John Paul, an enigmatic figure, is believed to be the mastermind behind the global surge of terrorism and genocide in the wake of a devastating homemade nuclear attack on Sarajevo. The once democratic nations have morphed into totalitarian surveillance states in a desperate bid to maintain security, while the developing world crumbles under the weight of internal wars and massacres.

Enter Clavis Shepherd, a seasoned member of the USA Special Forces, tasked with the daunting mission of tracking down and neutralizing John Paul. As Clavis navigates the ruins of civilization, he uncovers a chilling truth: the existence of a "Genocidal Organ" within the human body, capable of unleashing unimaginable destruction when triggered by specific words.

Based on Project Itoh's thought-provoking sci-fi novel, "Genocidal Organ" delves into a dystopian future shaped by fear and control, questioning the delicate balance between freedom and security. As Clavis closes in on his target, he must confront the unsettling reality of humanity's darkest potential. Will he be able to handle the truth, or will it consume him, and the world, in darkness?
